result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Michael Pflug

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank J. Parise in court for James Michael Pflug. Defendant James Michael Pflug in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Parise just got a new offer and needs to discuss with the DE.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, James Michael Pflug, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State. Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
waiver of prelim time filed,  PH rescheduled from 08-25-22 to 09-08-22 at 8:30am Intake.  DA notified.

Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Michelle P, Kimberly A. The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.
